data.title: provide a EJS formatter

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: - VSCode Version: Code 1.11.0 (9122ec4b1068bd391e41974f46a4b54c1b9c90f9, 2017-04-05T20:59:05.375Z) - OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393 - Extensions ( **all disabled** ): |Extension|Author|Version| |---|---|---| |Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.13.0| |vscode-color|anseki|0.2.6| |code-beautifier|michelemelluso|1.7.2| |csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.1| |debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.7.2| |sass-indented|robinbentley|1.3.1|; --- ### Steps to Reproduce 1. create follow html ejs code in a file .html ```html <% if (something) { %> <%- mydata %> <% } %> ``` 2. issue a format code ( alt+shift+f ) ### Results ```html <% if (something) { %> <%- mydata %> <% } %> ``` ### Expected results ```html <% if (something) { %> <%- mydata %> <% } %> ``` ### Workarounds Use of a single initial character such as # and replace using regex during template compilation, eg. ```html # if (something) { <%- mydata %> # } ``` Details available here [Improving the syntax of EJS templates](http://2ality.com/2016/09/better-ejs.html)

data.title: ripreg does not find anything
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.0-insider
- OS Version: MacOs Sierra

Within my projects ripreg does not find anything
After further investigation it seems to be related to my settings:
If i select "use Exclude Settings" it wont find anything (compare to the normal search)
If i unselect "use Exclude Settings", it finds it all (and does it really fast!)

Here are my settings related to search
```json
"files.exclude": {
        "**/.metadata": true,
        "**/.bzrmeta": true,
        "**/.bzr": true,
        "**/.git": true,
        "**/.vscode": true,
        "**/tags": true,
        "**/.tags*": true,
        "**/.zip": true,
        "**/.DS_Store": true,
        "dist": true,
        "build": true
    },
    "search.exclude": {
        "**/node_modules": true,
        "build": true,
        "dist": true
    },
```
and my workspace settings
```json
"search.exclude": {
		"dist": true
	},
	"files.exclude": {
		"dist": true,
		"**compiled": true
	}
```

data.title: Feature request: Input available in the debug console
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.0
- OS Version: Mac OS X 10.12.3

You cannot debug any program which requires Input from the standard input because the debug console does not support input (in particular with Node.JS).

So the feature request is the ability to select the Debug Console output window and send there input (keystrokes), while preserving the bottom console input.

data.title: SCM progress API is still in proposed state
data.body:
Found by @stef-levesque in stef-levesque/vscode-perforce#41

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/api/node/extHost.api.impl.ts#L349

data.title: Feature request: allow "files to include/exclude" groups for multifile search to be saved in user settings
Feature request: multifile searches and files to include should be saved and navigable with cursor key
data.body:
It is very useful to go back to previous searches, but there is no way to do so in VSC. The easiest way to do it is what Sublime (and most CLI) does - just use the up cursor to go back in history, and the down cursor to go forward. The same should appply to "files to include/exclude".
Thanks

data.title: Multiple cursors on next reference?
data.body:
Hello, 

I think this feature was included in previous versions of vscode, but just after discover it, I think it disapear, the feature is the option to not create multiple cursors for every references of the selected text, The think is sometimes I've got a copy pasted from other code, or some example, and I wish to change the references of a variable or something, and I don't wish to break all my code, I think I used that 3 or 4 times some month ago, but now, I don't found this feature. 

Can it will be included?

Thanks.

data.title: Insider version wrongly reports available update
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.12.0-insider
Commit 6f42a236d521e9016a4d4fbf6aaf33cf3d9fad4e
Date 2017-04-03T06:26:22.872Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 xenial

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Check for available update (which will result in 'true' and a link to the insider download
2. Click to download and find version code-insiders_1.11.0-1491340448_amd64 to be downloaded

I would consider that a downgrade, not an upgrade...
This falsly reported available updates has been happening for a while now (I believe since the late 1.10 insider version)

data.title: Copy on drag drop not working on osx
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.0
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. The release notes show "unassigned" for the osx key. (this happened the moment I upgraded, no keybindings were changed) and closing/reopening vscode does not help.
![screen shot 2017-04-06 at 08 53 24](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/229311/24741572/c8157a1c-1aa6-11e7-8cb7-97e10bceb3ac.png)
2. As far as I can see all my keybindings are set to default (I have never changed them)
3. I see from the release notes online the assigned key should be option - if I use option it just ignores drag drop totally and re-selects the text to the cursor. Not even move drag drop happens. If I do not use the option key then normal drag drop move works.

1. open new window, paste text in new editor, don't save it
2. quit and start vscode => text remains
3. upgrade => text is gone :(

data.title: cp1252 encoding not detected in this case

- OS Version: Windows 10 1607

Steps to Reproduce:

set "files.autoGuessEncoding": true in settings

1. Open file saved with encoding ANSI (1252)
2. VS Code show encoding as UTF8
3. Reopen with Encoding -> there is no hint which encoding was guessed or if it was tried to guess

data.title: Opening multiple files via Ctrl+P, closes the currently opened file in VSCode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.0 (9122ec4b1068bd391e41974f46a4b54c1b9c90f9, 2017-04-05T20:59:05.375Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|code-gnu-global|austin|0.2.1|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.5|
|material-icon-theme|PKief|2.0.3|
|java|redhat|0.1.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a folder. I opened a folder to git source enlisting. 
2. Then I pressed Ctrl+P to open a file. UserManager.cpp.
3. The file opens in the editor. 
4. Next press Ctrl+P again to open another file "OrderMap.cpp"
5. The new file opens in editor and the previous file (UserManager.cpp) closes. Also the link to the previous file at the top of the editor pane(navigator pane which shows tabs of all files open) is also lost. 
6. If I try opening UserManager.cpp again the OpenMap.cpp closes. 


This problem is pretty consistent and not just with these two set of files. Take any file pair. (Tried with a different folder location as well for different set of files.)
It  also works normal as expected sometimes. Meaning It opens the different files (say Pressing Ctrl+P to open 4 different files one by one). 

But then after some time, say 4 files are open and I press Ctrl+P to open a 5th file, the new 5th file opens but I see now only 4 files in the navigation tab (top of the editor space). 
Of the previously opened 4 files is lost and is replaced with the new 5th file opened above.

data.title: Proposal for improved go to definition functionality
data.body:
## Introduction

It is very common for a project with webpack to use some kind of root resolve plugin which allows you to write import paths as if you were traversing from user defined root of the project directory.

## Example
Let's assume I defined root directory as `src`.
```
.
 src
    index.html
    main.js
    components
        Header
            Header.js
            index.js
    util          
         foo.js
```
If I want to import `foo` from within `Header.js` file I could write relative path or one taking advantage of root resolve plugin.
```javascript 
// Header.js
import foo from '../../util/foo'
import foo from 'util/foo'
```
These two imports are equivalent but `go to definition` works only on first one which si very unfortunate because in large project root resolve plugin is almost necessity to avoid crazy imports like `../../../../../foo`

## Version
1.11.0

data.title: 1.11 no longer respects keyboard mappings with `setxkbmap` on Linux

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

I have my Caps Lock key bound to Escape using `setxkbmap` on Linux. This worked fine till 1.10, but broke with 1.11. At first I thought it was an issue with the VSCodeVim extension, but the issue persists with all the other Vim extensions on the marketplace as well. Pressing the escape button still works as expected.

The binding is still respected everywhere else in the operating system, it's only Visual Studio Code that ignores it for some reason.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run `setxkbmap -option caps:escape` (binds caps to escape for the duration of the session)
2. Hitting caps lock when in insert mode (with a Vim extension like VSCodeVim installed) no longer puts you normal mode.
3. Hitting escape still works as expected and puts you in normal mode.

data.title: Symbol lookup works incorrect.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.0 (9122ec4b1068bd391e41974f46a4b54c1b9c90f9, 2017-04-05T21:13:24.700Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-72-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|code-gnu-global|austin|0.2.1|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.5|;

[Description]
There is a library folder in the project where some C++ headers are resided. Despite the fact that path is included to the file "c_cpp_properties.json", variables from the library cannot be found via "Go to definition" command (but sometimes it's working for some reason). Both relative and absolute path definitions were used.

Example:
       {
            "name": "Linux",
            "includePath": [
                "/opt/arduino-1.8.1/hardware/arduino/avr/cores",
                "/opt/arduino-1.8.1/hardware/arduino/avr",
                "../library/Messaging.poll"
            ],
            "browse": {
                "limitSymbolsToIncludedHeaders": true,
                "databaseFilename": ""
            }
        },


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a simple C++ project.
2. Create a library folder and some code inside.
3. Use some sources from the library folder in the project.
4. Adjust "c_cpp_properties.json" to make it pointing to the library folder.
5. Try to lookup a name present in the library from the project's file.

data.title: [Feature] Preserve case in Find and replace

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It would be nice to have Preserve case feature in find and replace.

What I mean is: searching for 'BadJob' and replacing with 'GoodJob' would do the following replacements

```
'badjob' -> 'goodjob'  
'BadJob' -> 'GoodJob'  
'badJob' -> 'goodJob'  
'BADJOB' -> 'GOODJOB'
```

data.title: Overwhelming number files in the source control hub for git (~72000) causing software to freeze
data.body:
#<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode  #Version: 1.11.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Education Version:1607 OS Build: 14393.953 

After updating to the version I get an overwhelming number files in the source control hub for git ~72000
Software freezes when running terminal using dotnet and such. 

Freezes when I disregard changes or unstage changes. Reinstall does not fix.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Update to Version 1.11.0
2. Click on source control tab
